octavia_load_balancer_create_l7_rule_typ: The L7 rule searches for the cookie value equal to its key and compares its value to the rule value.
The rule compares the last part of the URI with the value parameter of the rule (e.g. “txt”, “jpg”, etc.).
The rule searches for a header defined in the key parameter and compares it to the value parameter of the rule.
The rule compares the HTTP/1.1 hostname of the request with the value parameter of the rule.
The rule compares the path portion of the HTTP URI with the value parameter of the rule.
The rule matches if the client has presented a certificate for TLS client authentication. This does not mean that the certificate is valid.
This rule will match the validation result of the TLS client authentication certificate.
The rule searches for a Unique Name field defined in the key parameter and compares it to the value parameter of the rule.
octavia_load_balancer_create_l7_rule_key: The key to use for the comparison. For example, the name of the cookie to evaluate.
The key can only be composed of alphanumeric characters and the following characters: !#$%&'*+-.^_`|~
octavia_load_balancer_create_l7_rule_val: The value used by the comparison type. For example, the type of file to compare.
The value entered is not a valid regular expression.
For an ‘SSL verify result’ type L7 rule, the value must be an integer greater than or equal to 0.
For a ‘Cookie’ type L7 rule, the value can only be composed of alphanumeric characters and the following characters: !#$%&'()*+-./:<=>?@[]^_`{|}~
The value can only contain alphanumeric characters and the following characters: !"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[]^_`{|}~\\
octavia_load_balancer_create_l7_rule_inv: When set to “true”, the rule logic is reversed.
